subject: Re-structuring and rationalizing the project cost of PPP projects and re-bidding.

Extn.; 2223 2318 2468 2553 (Ministry of Shipping, Road Transport and Highways) 01-5 U 6, 0qzr-10, EGT; Tff faari-110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No:: 11041/218/2007-Admn: 20 .05.2009 POLICY MATTERS TECHNICAL (28/2009) (Decision taken on Technical Division File No NHAICoord/4/2009) Sub: Re-structuringand_ rationalizing_the_project_cost_of PPP_projects_and_re-bidding reg It has earlier been decided with the approval of the Competent Authority that for the projects for which bids were invited and no bid received, re-structuring of the projects will be carried out as per the "guidelines for re-structuring" issued by NHAI After re-structuring the project will be offered to the already prequalified applicants subject to clause 3.5.2 of RFQ without going back to the RFQ stage: Subsequently, this procedure was also agreed in case of single bids. 2 The matter regarding issue of RFP to the already prequalified bidder after re-structuring of the project came up for discussion during the review meeting taken by Secretary (RT&H) o 14.5.09. It was mentioned that there has been objections from bidders to this process as it may happen that fresh bidder who might have been qualified with the reduction in the cost of the project is not getting chance for prequalification 3 Reference was also made to the minutes of the meeting of the Committee of Secretaries (CoS) under the Chairmanship of Cabinet Secretary held on 26.3.2009 wherein while discussing opening of the single bids received for PPP project it was mentioned that while re-structuring the project and re-bidding them for getting positive response RFQ will have to be floated in the situation of project cost getting reduced by more than 10-15% on re-structuring: 4_ In view of the above, it has now been decided that offering of the re-structured projects to the already prequalified applicants may be resorted to in the situation of project cost getting reduced upto 15% on re-structuring: In the cases where projects costs are getting reduced by more than 15% on re-structuring, the RFQ will be floated again. 5, This issues with the approval of Competent Authority: kuy (S.K.
